title: Understand Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs free energy equation is given by $$∆G=∆H-T∆S$$. For a reaction to be non-spontaneous, ∆G must be greater than $$0$$.

title: Rewrite the Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: Reformulate the equation as T=(∆H-∆G)/∆S to solve for T when ∆G is zero.

title: Calculate Entropy Change
text: The change in entropy (∆S) can be calculated using the values for ∆H and ∆G provided.

title: Calculate Temperature
text: Use the equation T=(∆H-∆G)/∆S to determine the temperature with the calculated ∆S value.
